sub_title: Human Resources Assistant at International Criminal Court until end 2015.
summary:
Throughout my professional years, I have gained substantial work experience in the field of Administration and Human Resources, including international professional experience. I thoroughly enjoy working in international and multi-cultural environments, building relationships with professionals at all levels and promoting a strong communication network. 

Strengths:
I see myself as a meticulous employee with excellent organisational and communication skills, able to adapt to the challenges which arise through working in any demanding environment.  I have great respect for sensitive and confidential issues, and thrive on providing Human Resources and Administrative assistance in order to achieve common goals. I am computer literate having achieved the European Computer Driving License (ECDL) certificate.

profile_positions.description: Since April 2015 I have been on loan to the ICC from the ICTY to assist with a restructuring project.  The tasks involved are comparable to ICTY, however while the HR duties are similar, the processing of tasks is different, providing an alternative prospective to HR procedures.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Assistant

company.name: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia

profile_positions.company: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
profile_positions.description:
Vacancy Announcements/Job Openings:
• prepare and advertise vacancy announcements
• maintain vacancy announcement files, tracking the status of vacancies from posting to   recruitment of candidate
• establish and monitor budgets
• create and update Excel spreadsheets of process
Pre-employment Screening and Interviews:
• screen applications; schedule candidate tests and interviews
• arrange panel meetings for Central Review Bodies following selection/rostering of candidates
Administrative Support in Recruitment:
• provide administrative support; prepare correspondence to prospective candidates and relevant  offices
• schedule the Global General Services Test (GGST), finance test and coordinate competitive   
  recruitment examinations, interview prospective candidates, finalize interview reports and finalizing the recruitment process;
• analyse, maintain and provide statistics to auditors and third parties;
Advice and Staff Support:
• prepare job offers
• provide advice and general guidance to staff on recruitment procedures.
Staff Administration Support:
• Assess contractual status of staff members
• review and update the status of benefits and allowances such as dependency allowances, rental subsidies, education grant and assignment grants
• review, process and advise on entitlements such as official travel, including home leave 
  and  education grant travel, shipment and pension fund
• carry out induction for new staff members, verifying all documents; provide authoritative 
  advice to staff members on staff administration matters;
Special Service Agreement Contracts:
• prepare contracts for consultants and individual contractors
• calculate and process the contract finances, including travel and DSA
• maintain document management, recording the status in Excel
Internships:
• Supervisor for the Internship Programme (+/-100 interns). Recruit interns to manage the programme, ensuring that the programme runs smoothly and to the satisfaction of all departments.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Office Management Support:
• provided overall administrative support 
• screened, logged and prioritized incoming correspondence for appropriate action and distribution
• drafted and edited all correspondence and reports for despatch
• prepared travel folders including travel requests, DSA rates, travel and hotel bookings
• researched documents, compiled information, assisted with the preparation of presentations, reports and outreach material.

Planning and Organising:
• managed my Programme Officer's agenda
• maintained the general electronic filing system of correspondence and contacts database
• facilitated the general planning, preparation and efficient overseeing of meetings internally and externally, including teleconference calls
• liaised with meeting participants and offered support when necessary, followed-up on
  correspondence with participants on meeting related logistic information;
• Drafted meeting minutes
profile_positions.title: Personal Assistant
Data Entry Clerk

profile_positions.description:
I worked in the Music Centre of the International School of The Hague on a voluntary basis. 
 My duties included:
• organizing and managing all administrative tasks
• liaising with students, parents and teachers with regard to the smooth running of music lessons
• updating and maintaining agendas ensuring that all involved with the Music Centre were 
  continually fully informed of events, including creating and displaying posters
• providing general assistance and support to visitors (adults and students) to the Music Centre
profile_positions.title: Administrative Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• taught English to non-English speaking adults at the school, as well as private teaching to
  a number of adults and children of the Korean, Japanese, Taiwanese and Vietnamese  
  communities in Hanoi.
• as well as English language skills, I taught presentation and confidence building skills to 
  encourage the non-native speaker to feel comfortable in a social environment.
profile_positions.title: English Language Teacher

profile_positions.description:
Committee member responsible for membership which involved:
• meeting, greeting and orienting multi-cultural newcomers to Hanoi
• compiling and continually updating membership data
• attending all HIWC functions including board meetings
• organising and distributing the monthly newsletter
profile_positions.title: Membership Secretary

profile_positions.description:
• performed a full range of administrative duties relating to consular, immigration and commercial affairs including the bidding for tenders
• liaised with senior officials from local government bodies with regard to confidential information relating to immigration and asylum affairs
• interviewed and followed up business and student visa applications which required strong interpersonal skills and good analytical skills to complete the visa application process
• prepared and processed correspondence to the Belgium Ministry of Foreign Affairs in English, French and Dutch; translated and edited various correspondence and documents from French and Dutch into English
• provided the expected support to visa applicants, following up on their applications and meeting the deadlines expected
profile_positions.title: Administrative Assistant
Administrative Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
• organized and managed a wide scope of administrative tasks;
• proof read and final editing of complex documents and reports drafted by non-English speaking engineers
• organized and managed the smooth running of meetings, taking minutes, transcribing the notes for final approval and participated on the logistics side of an international conference
• arranged travel itineraries
• developed strategies to prioritise tasks to successfully meet the expectations of the engineers
  in order to meet deadlines
• liaised with departments within Shell, co-ordinating information as necessary.
profile_positions.title: Secretary
